result.execSummary:
The defendant Brent Ford Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation on Count 3, any bail on deposit to be applied. If revoked, to be paid from 25% of prison funds and collected by DOC on extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court WAIVED all NON-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.
Consecutive to: This is a time served disposition.
Extended Supervision and Probation conditions the same.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA surcharge during period of probation, any bail on deposit to be applied. If revoked, to be paid from 25 % of prison funds and will be collected by DOC on extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
Court advised defendant that after this Felony conviction, he may not use or possess a firearm.

No violent contact with Helena R. and her minor children, and Helen R.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Batterers Intervention program or a course in anger management - pending evaluation.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

AODA assessment and comly with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending review on March 6, 2015 at 1:30pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brent Ford Taylor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (25 pages) commencing NOVEMBER 12, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Brent Ford Taylor not in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve condition time on pending case.
Amend entry of 10/7/2014 reflects corrected information as to Statute number.

Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 174 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 174 DAYS time served, CONSECUTIVE. This is a Time Served Disposition. Pay all Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation on Count 3, any bail on deposit to be applied, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, and collected by DOC on extended supervision, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all court costs, fees, and surcharges.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 3 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive, as 2 YEARS of initial confinement, and 1 YEAR of extended supervision. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count 2, but consecutive any other sentence. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve (as to each count) 20 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management -pending evaluation.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No violent contact with Helena R. and her minor children, and Helen R.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation, any bail on deposit to be applied, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, and collected by DOC on extended supervision, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
*Court advised defendant that after this Felony conviction he may not use or possess a firearm, and may not vote until his civil rights are restored.
*Defendant eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, BUT NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Positive Drug Test, defendant has valid prescription.

Signed & Filed, Order: Defendant, Brent Taylor is allowed to be released on the Electronic Bracelet to make and attend doctor appointments for his arm. Justice point must be advised, in advance, of the appointment time.
Received & Filed, Notice of Motion and Motion To Modify Sentence.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision for GPS & Electronic Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms. Defendant has NO Release - 24 HOUR curfew.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED & COUNTS 2 & 3
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Court VACATED Final Pretrial & Jury Trial dates. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Plea & Sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 1
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Misdemeanor Possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(e), an unclassifed Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark S. Tishberg in court, defendant Brent Ford Taylor not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea Hearing. Defendant not produced from bullpen. Defense counsel has not prepared for Plea Hearing, requested an adjourned plea hearing prior to trail date. Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in branch 23.
Received & Filed, Cover Letter & PRO SE Motion to Dismiss.

Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Status Conference/Motion to Withdraw. Prior defense counsel previously withdrew before Judge Flanagan for branch 23. Attorney Tishberg recently appointed requested case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial, as well as potential Plea Hearing/Status Conference.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Court ordered State to provide copy of all discovery to defense counsel by 9/5/2014 by 4 pm to be available for pick up by defense counsel at D.A. office. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in court with attorney Odalo J. Ohiku.  Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Br. 4 for Br. 23. 
Court accepted case from Branch 23 to take a plea on cases; (2014CF1126, 2014CF1636, 2014CF3069 and 2014CF3069).  Following a lengthy colleqy, the Court found that defendant did not indicate that he knowingly voluntarily pleaded and vacates all findings.   Attorney Odalo Ohiku informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of defense counsel to withdraw is heard and granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 23 on 9-3-2014 at 8:30 am.   Case 2014CM196 returned to Branch 46 and remains calendared for Status Conference on 9-3-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld
Case spun to branch 04, Judge Flanagan.

Attorney Odalo J. Ohiku in court, defendant Brent Ford Taylor not in court, in custody.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Jury Trial. Defendant NOT produced, being transfered to hospital. Defense counsel requested case be adjourned for Jury Trial. Court advised defense counsel medical documentation will need to be submitted to the court. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Status Conference based on negotiations between state and defense counsel. Speedy Trial Demand time limits waived til next Jury Trial date due to adjournment. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Odalo J. Ohiku in court via telephone, defendant Brent Ford Taylor not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel unable to appear due to family emergency. Case remains set for trial, parties ready to proceed. Defense and court advised that the state may file new charges. Discussion as to global resolution of 14CF1126, 14CF1636 & 14CM196. Case adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23.

Attorney Odalo J Ohiku in court, defendant Brent Ford Taylor not in court, in custody.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA File NOT in court. Discussion regarding No contact order, and bail. Arguments from state and defense. Victim not in court, state advised court of victim's request through victim witness advocate. Defense requested no violent contact order. State opposes. Court DENIED request, no contact order remains in effect. State advised court of possible new charges, state to file any amended information in advance of Final Pretrial date. State's offer remains open until 7/11/2014 at 5:00 p.m. Defense counsel requested Final Pretrial date to be rescheduled, GRANTED. Case adjourned for rescheduled Final Pretrial & Jury Trial in branch 23.

Attorney Odalo J Ohiku in court, defendant Brent Ford Taylor not in court, in custody.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel recently appointed, requested a bail hearing to address no contact order. State to notify victim of next court date. Case adjourned for a bail/bond hearing in branch 23.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in custody.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lamke informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel to date, all prior dates remain set for trial.  Status conference scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defense counsel in court to request case be set for Motion To Withdraw as Counsel.  ADA Davis notifed via telephone. Case set for 5/28/2014 at 1:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew A Lamke in court, defendant Brent Ford Taylor not in court, in custody.  Michael C Schindhelm for Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court withheld ruling on Joinder, to be argued and decided at next court date.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.   Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson for Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #07CM2702 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Kyle Baus.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in custody.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor count 3.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
